intro: Tarenna mangenotii, commonly known as the Madagascar star-anise, is a climbing shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by distinctive star-shaped fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
